hypothesis_content.title: Stablecoin Supply Expansion Regime Filter
hypothesis_content.statement: A confirmed weekly increase in aggregate stablecoin supply (USDT+USDC) of >0.5% shifts the effective trading regime from NEUTRAL to BULL for the purposes of momentum strategies, invalidating mean-reversion setups and favoring breakout entries.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Stablecoin supply is the purest measure of on-chain liquidity available for buying crypto assets. Sustained expansion is a direct, causal inflow of capital, creating a structural bid and increasing the probability of trend continuation over mean reversion.
entry_conditions: 7-day aggregate stablecoin supply (USDT+USDC) increases by ≥0.5% (data from DeFiLlama/Glassnode)
The increase follows a period of flat or contracting supply (prior 2 weeks change ≤0%)
BTC is above its 50-day moving average

exit_conditions.take_profit: Not applicable - this is a regime filter hypothesis.
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Stablecoin supply growth stalls (next weekly print ≤0%)
exit_conditions.time_exit: Hypothesis is evaluated weekly. A 'short' signal occurs if supply contracts by ≥0.3%.

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Stablecoin supply expands but prices fail to respond positively or continue to trend sideways/negative, indicating other overpowering selling pressure or off-exchange dynamics.
